contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Five ships of the [[United States Navy]] have been named '''''Buffalo''''', the first after the [[American Bison|large mammal]], the others after the city of [[Buffalo, New York]]. * The {{USS|Buffalo|1813}} was a 3-gun sloop purchased April 1813 at Philadelphia and attached to the Delaware Flotilla. She took part in the 29 July 1813 attack on the HMS ''Junon'' and HMS ''Martin''. She was sold 12 August 1816. * The {{USS|Buffalo|1892}} was an auxiliary cruiser purchased for use in the Spanish-American War. * The {{USS|Buffalo|CL-99}} was a planned {{sclass-|Cleveland|cruiser|0}} [[light cruiser]] that was converted into the {{sclass-|Independence|aircraft carrier|0}} [[light aircraft carrier]] {{USS|Bataan|CVL-29}}. * The {{USS|Buffalo|CL-110}} was a planned {{sclass-|Fargo|cruiser|0}} light cruiser, laid down on 3 April 1944 but the contract for her construction was canceled on 12 August 1945. Her unfinished hull was scrapped. * The {{USS|Buffalo|SSN-715}} is the 25th {{sclass-|Los Angeles|submarine|0}} nuclear attack submarine and is currently in service ==References== *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/b10-list.htm}} *{{NVR|http://www.nvr.navy.mil/nvrships/details/SSN715.htm}} {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Buffalo, USS}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
